page.title: 13 Drapers Almshouse
page.content: The Drapers Almshouses are old folks homes. It is a beautiful place, with cottages and a home which opened in 1981. It was founded and paid for by Michael Yoakley, who died in 1708.The cottages were started in 1709 and additions have been made since then. The gardens are very beautiful with a massive fir tree and flower beds. The Matron lives in the clockhouse which has a Quaker chapel attached. There are 40 cottages, 20 beds and in the home four sick-beds. People from 60 upwards can live there.
